subject: Design
title: Gropius in America: Bauhaus Goes to Harvard
description: A quick, practical guide to Gropius in America: Bauhaus Goes to Harvard.

hook.text: In 1937, Walter Gropius became chair of architecture at Harvard. The Bauhaus conquered America from a classroom.

buildup.text: Fleeing Nazi Germany, Gropius brought Bauhaus teaching methods to the most prestigious university in America.

discovery.text: He replaced Harvard's Beaux-Arts curriculum with modernist principles. A generation of American architects was reshaped.

twist.text: Gropius's American buildings were criticized as bland boxes. His teaching mattered more than his architecture.

climax.text: Through Harvard, Bauhaus ideas entered corporate America, shaping offices, campuses, and cities.

punchline.text: The Bauhaus's greatest American export wasn't a building â€” it was a curriculum.

quiz.question: How did Gropius spread Bauhaus ideas in America?
options: Became chair at Harvard and changed their architecture curriculum
